newsitem.title: UK: Tesco, food retailers off on price fears.
newsitem.headline: Tesco, food retailers off on price fears.

text.p: Tesco led supermarket stocks lower Wednesday, amid renewed concern about the company's forthcoming Autumn price campaign, traders at leading brokerages said.
Sources said analysts at NatWest had said Tesco's price campaign would be more aggressive than reports earlier this week, though analysts at the brokerage declined comment.
Tesco was down 6p at 294 by 1246 GMT, J. Sainsbury Plc was off 4p at 382-1/2, Safeway Plc was 4p lower at 327 and ASDA Group Plc was down 1/2p at 110p.
Tesco was the most active stock in London, with volume reaching 8.2 million shares.
Market sources said there was talk that Tesco would launch on Monday a campaign called "Unbeatable Value;" its latest salvo in an intense price war raging between leading supermarket operators.

Supermarket stocks dropped earlier this week amid rumours Tesco was planning a major new price campaign, though Tesco yesterday played down the significance of its plans saying they did not go beyond Autumn initiatives common for UK food retailers.
A Tesco spokesman today declined comment on the latest market speculation.
